alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 7:19PM EST until March 13 at 9:46PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana... White River. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... White River. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Moderate flooding in the Seymour area on the East Fork White River is expected to persist into Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Newberry. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress. Some state and county roads flood. County Road 600 W just north of river flooded by possibly more than two feet of water for a considerable distance in Mary Long Cutoff Area. County Roads 900 W and 750 S begin to flood in Greene County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Tuesday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.6 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning to around 7 feet then slowly fall off to about 6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday morning by around 630 AM EST /530 AM CST/.
